name: Avoid calling properties that clone values in loops
description:
List all methods that call the get accessor of a property inside a loop whenever the accessor returns a cloned object.
A cloned object is retrieved from a call to the System.ICloneable.Clone method.

Limitation: Due to the way this quality rule is implemented, false positive can be found if:
- a getter is doing call to Clone method AND
- if a method calls this getter but not in a loop AND
- if the method calls another getter in a loop
output:
This report lists all artifacts with code calling properties that clone values in loops.
It provides the following information:
 Artifact full name
remediation: Whenever possible assign the property to a local variable outside the iteration statement and use the local variable inside the iteration statement.
total: This counts all artifacts that can contain code (e.g. methods in classes but not in interfaces)
